item.title: Lola Colt
item.description: Lola Colt is a 1967 Spaghetti Western film directed by Siro Marcellini.

item.title: Fury of Johnny Kid
item.description: Fury of Johnny Kid is a 1967 Italian-Spanish film directed by Gianni Puccini. The Italian and Spanish versions of the film have different ending. The film is a spaghetti western version of William Shakespeare's tragedy Romeo and Juliet.

item.title: May God Forgive You... But I Won't
item.description: May God Forgive You... But I Won't is a 1968 Italian Spaghetti Western film written and directed by Vincenzo Musolino.

item.title: My Name Is Pecos
item.description: Due once di piombo is a 1967 Italian Spaghetti Western film directed by Maurizio Lucidi.

item.title: Death Rides Along
item.description: Death Rides Along is a 1967 Italian Spaghetti Western film directed by Giuseppe Vari.

item.title: The Forgotten Pistolero
item.description: The Forgotten Pistolero is a 1969 Italian Spaghetti Western film co-written and directed by Ferdinando Baldi. The film is a western adaptation of the Greek myth of Orestes, subject of three famous drama-plays by Aeschylus, Sophocles and Euripides. Ulrich P. Bruckner puts it among the "most interesting and most touching Spaghetti Westerns of the late sixties".

item.title: Long Days of Hate
item.description: Long Days of Hate is a 1968 Italian spaghetti western film directed by Gianfranco Baldanello.

item.title: Ringo the Lone Rider
item.description: Ringo the Lone Rider is a 1968 Spanish-Italian Spaghetti western film directed by Rafael Romero Marchent.

item.title: Chuck Moll
item.description: Chuck Moll is a 1970 Italian spaghetti western. The film represents the directorial debut of Enzo Barboni, who was, until then, a respected cinematographer. He replaced Ferdinando Baldi, who was fired by the producer Manolo Bolognini because of his insistence in wanting to engage the actress Annabella Incontrera in the role of Sheila.

item.title: Savage Guns
item.description: Savage Guns is a low-budget spaghetti western from 1971, directed by Demofilo Fidani and starring Robert Woods.
